option: Specifies (the name of) a source-code mark-definition file to be read. The marks can then be used in assertions to identify the program parts to which assertions apply. The default is no mark file. This option can be used multiple times to specify multiple mark files. Each use of adds one mark-definition file. Mark-definition files are usually automatically generated from source-code files, where marks are embedded as comments. Tidorum provides the program "find_marks" for generating mark-definition files from source code.
